column2: SCORE
Environmental Planning Reviewer
column6:
DISCLAIMER:
Always double-check the values given in this document with the actual laws.

column2: Enp Part 1 (abg)   55 POINTS

In case an infrastructure or a development facility's operation requires a public utility franchise, the facility operator must be Filipino or if a corporation, it must be duly registered with the SEC and owned up to at least how many percent by Filipinos? 

a. 50%  b. 60%  c. 70%  d. 75%

Projects which would have difficulty in sourcing funds may be financed partly from direct government appropriations and/or from Official Development Assistance (ODA) of foreign governments or institutions not exceeding how many percent of the project cost?

a. 50%  b. 60%  c. 70%  d. 75%

The largest city in its country or region, disproportionately larger than any others in the urban hierarchy.                                                              a. CBD     b. Primate City  c. Metropolis   d. Metropolitan

This city has been called "the most primate city on Earth", being roughly 35 times larger than its country’s second-largest city.
 a. Bangkok b. New York City c. Budapest d. Jakarta

Also called world city or sometimes alpha city or world center, is a city which is a primary node in the global economic network. Popularized by sociologist Saskia Sassen in her 1991 work, The Global City: New York, London, Tokyo.                                                          a. Primate City  b. Metropolis  c. Global City d. Megalopolis

A measure of statistical dispersion intended to represent the income or wealth distribution of a nation's residents, and is the most commonly used measurement of inequality.                                                                                                                                                                                a. Wealth Index  b. Theil Index  c. Hoover Index  d. Gini Coefficient

Unequal distribution of household or individual income across the various participants in an economy. It is often presented as the percentage of income to a percentage of population.                                                                                                                                        a.Economic Gap   b. Income Inequality   c. Income Variance  d. Wealth Variance

In any case, the minimum for the Gini coefficient, which corresponds to total equality, is?                                                                                                                   a. one   b. negative   c. zero   c. infinity

In Lorenz curve, the extent to which the curve sags below a straight diagonal line indicates the degree of?                                                          a. inequality of distribution b. equality of distribution

Indicates maximum inequality in Gini Index.                                                                                                                                                              a. one  b. negative c. zero  c. infinity

This measure is used for the United Nations Development Programme Human Development Indicators, it compares how much richer the top 20% of populations are to the bottom 20% of a given population.                                                                                                                           a. 20:20    b. Theil Index c. Hoover Index   d. Atkinson Index

A statistic primarily used to measure economic inequality and other economic phenomena, though it has also been used to measure racial segregation. It can be viewed as a measure of redundancy, lack of diversity, isolation, segregation, inequality, non-randomness, and compressibility.                                                                                                                                                                                                          a. 20:20    b. Theil Index c. Hoover Index   d. Gini Index

Defined as the ratio of the richest 10% of the population's share of gross national income divided by the poorest 40%'s share.                          a. 10:40    b. Theil Index c. Hoover Index   d. Palma Ratio

The process of finding the present value of future amount is called                                                                                                                         a. Return of Investment  b. Payback c. Cash Flow   d. Discounting

A popular financial metric for evaluating the financial consequences of investments and actions.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          a. Return of Investment  b. Payback c. Cash Flow   d. Discounting

. A cash flow summary adjusted to reflect the time value of money, funds that will flow in or flow out at some time in the future are viewed as having less value, today, than an equal amount that flows today.                                                                                                                     a. Net Present Value  b. Payback c. Discounted Cash Flow  d. Discounting

Used in capital budgeting to analyze the profitability of a projected investment or project.                                                                                     a. Net Present Value  b. Payback c. Discounted Cash Flow  d. Discounting

The rights of ICCs/IPs to their ancestral domains include i. Right to develop lands and natural resources ii. Right to be resettled in case of displacement iii. Right to regulate the entry of migrants iv. Right to safe and clean air and water v. Right to free education and access to modern technologies vi. Right to resolve conflicts                                                                                                                                                     a. i,ii,iii,iv,v    b. ii,iii,iv,v,vi    c. i,ii,iii,iv,vi,      d. i.ii,iv,v,vi

In this process of ADSDPP preparation, The Council of Elders/Leaders, with the assistance of the NCIP, shall conduct a workshop in every village within the ancestral domain to determine the will of the community members regarding the kind of development the community should pursue in terms of livelihood, education, infrastructure, self-governance, environment, natural resources, culture and other aspects.                                                                                                                                                                                              a. Baseline survey b. Formulation of the ADSDPP c. Development needs assessment d. Validation of the plan

How many ethnic groups are there in the Philippines?                                                                                                                                             a. 100  b. 110  c. 10  d. 1100

The third step in the technical processes involved in ADSDPP plan preparation.                                                                                                   a. Baseline survey b. Formulation of the ADSDPP c. Development needs assessment d. Validation of the plan

Using ethno-ecological framework, athropologist Eric S. Casiño suggested that all ethnic groups in the Philippines be classified into             a. lowland and upland dwellers b. tinges and malays c. negritoes and malay d. christians and non-christians

Groups of IPs according to religious beliefs or acculturation EXCEPT:                                                                                                                   a. Muslims b. Lumads c. Christians d. Malays

Jocano's five typologies of ethnic groups according to levels of social organization. i. puro ii. banwa iii. ili  iv. Tausug v. magami  vi. Pisan       a. i,ii,iii,iv,v     b. ii,iii,iv,v,vi            c. i,ii,iii,v,vi           d. i,ii,iv,v,vi

The detailed components of development plans for ancestral domain communities for basic social services cover the following except:           a. Relevant education/ functional literacy b. Alternative holistic health program and nutrition integrating IKSP on health care approach and healing c. Credit support service d. Lighting/ electricity/ mini-hydro power e. Potable water systems

The detailed components of development plans for ancestral domain communities for Agricultural/on-farm improvements cover the following except:                                                                                                                                                                                           a. Technology-sustainable agriculture, biodynamic farming technology, multiple cropping         b. Handicraft, metal craft, wood craft, etc.            c. Post-harvest management and facilities            d. Livestock raising            e. Crop eco-system development

To ensure proper representation of the IPs in the NCIP, the law provides for the position of how many commissioners? How many of whom shall be women?                                                                                                                                                                                 a. 8 commissioners, 3 of whom shall be women                  b. 7 commissioners, 2 of whom shall be women                                                      c. 7 commissioners, 3 of whom shall be women                   d. 8 commissioners, 2 of whom shall be women

Which is not included in the main features and description of the ADSDPP?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          a. The plan should be built upon existing resources including indigenous knowledge systems, practices and traditional institutions.                b. The plan should be simple and practicable.                                                                                                                                                        c. The plan should be responsive to the needs and aspirations of the communities.                                                                                            d. The plan should be based on facts and figures.                                                                                                                                                  e. The plan should be based on community analysis.                                                                                                                                              f. The plan could be written in the vernacular.                                                                                                                                                         g. None of the Above

The right of ownership and possessionof the ICCs/IPs to their ancestral lands includes: 
i. The right to transfer land/ property in accordance with their customary laws and traditions.
ii. The right to redeem their land/property that had been transferred to a non-member of the concerned ICC/IP under any form of unacceptable terms and conditions, within fifteen (15) years from the date of transfer 
iii. The right to develop, control and use lands and territories traditionally occupied 
iv. The right to benefit and share the profits from the allocation and utilization of natural resources found therein.                                        a. i,iii  b. i, ii  c. iii, iv   d. i, ii, iii, i

Prior to the enactment of RA 8371 in 1997 the responsibility of carrying out the Constitutional provisions on IPs was initially assumed by whom?                                                                                                                                                                                                                        a. The President of the Philippines b. DENR c. DPWH    d. LGU

His characterization of indigenous settlement patterns found the spatial patterns of pre-colonial settlements as the outcome of ecological adaptations of the early inhabitants to the peculiar topography of the Philippine archipelago.
a. Robert Fox   b. William Henry Scott
c. Robert Reed   d. Samuel Tan

Renting goods to general public including repair and installation services fall under this type of business.                                                          a. Retail Trade  b. Tourism c. Service  c. Wholesale trade

It is the extension of the CBD.                                                                                                                                                                                     a. Neighborhood Center  b. Minor CBD c. Major CBD   d. Commercial Strip

A functional sub-area of the CBD which normally consists of a group of high-rise office buildings, a financial district and a hotel-convention district.                                                                                                                                                                                       a. frame       b. built-up core       c. minor CBD        d. major CBD

A functional sub-area of the CBD which includes parking areas, convention/entertainment district, wholesale/warehouse area, government cluster, medical area, public housing, skid row, and urban renewal zone.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        a. frame        b. built-up core     c. minor CBD       d. major CBD

In formulation of sectoral proposals and recommendations in planning process, the following are the steps or details involved except for one: 
i. Identify specific aspect of commercial activity needing expansion/development
ii. Identify problems, needs/demands 
iii. Identify possible location 
iv. Formulate specific policies/strategies                                                                                                                           
a. i,ii, iii      b. i,ii,iii,iv        c. ii,iii, iv          d. i,iii,iv

This planning process is based on locality’s comparative advantage or commercial development and uses analysis tools such as SWOT analysis and Site selection criteria
a. Formulation of goals and objectives
b. Formulation of sectoral proposals and recommendations 
c. Determination of development needs
d. Assessment of existing situation

Formerly the PAWB.                                                                                                                                                                                                  a. BMB     b. NPC      c. DENR     d. PAMB

In 2008, how many out of the 206 then known mammal species native to the Philippines were included in the International Union for the Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Red Data List of Threatened Species (IUCN, 2008)?                                                                                            a. 108 b. 58 c. 78 d. 68

2018 International day for biological diversity is on?                                                                                                                                                  a. May 22 b. May 12 c. May 20 d. May 25

One (1) RHM (rural health mid-wife) is the standard personnel population per how many patients?                                                                     a. 1,000 b. 20,000 c. 5,000 d. 15,000
For largest colleges and universities, the campus should be at least how many hectares per minimum of 10,000 students.                               a. 5 b. 6 c. 7 d. 8

Determine MHO manpower requirement for out-patient care, given: Cases of gastro-enteritis = 150,000 A patient will seek consultation = 1 X (once) Physician’s time (duration in minutes) = 15 minutes Physician’s productive time = 4 hours Working days in one year = 272                  a. 35 MHO b. 46 MHO c. 42 MHO d. 44 MHO

What is the suggested bed requirement for Regional Hospitals?                                                                                                                            a. 100-199 b. 200-299 c. 300 and above d. 6 to 24
How far should a proposed new government hospital be from any existing government hospital?                                                                         a. 20 km b. 25 km c. 35 km d. 50 km

What is the standard area in hectare/s for a provincial hospital?                                                                                                                         a. 1.5      b. 2       c. 2.5     d. 3.5

What is the average per capita solid waste generation in Metro Manila?                                                                                                                a. 0.32 kg/day b. 0.40 kg/day c. 0.23 kg/day d. 0.60 kg/day
A dump site shall not be closer than how many meters from waterways or any surface water resources, aquifier or ground water reservoir?    a. 30 meters b. 50 meters c. 25 meters d. 15 meters

Compute the crude death rate (CDR) given below: 1995 Population: 75,000 Number of deaths: 1,500                                                                a. 25% per 1000 population              b. 20% per 1000 population         c. 50% per 1000 population        d. 75% per 1000 population

Using the CDR result above, project the number of deaths if projected population by year 2000 increases by 5% with the given 1995 population of 75,000.                                                                                                                                                                                                  a. 1,575     b. 1,500      c. 2,000      d. 1,750

The crude death rate is called “crude” because:                                                                                                                                                       a. it gives the number of deaths occurring among the population of a given geographical area during a given year                                            b. it does not take into account age or sex differences among the population                                                                                                        c. it is in a natural state                                                                                                                                                                                        d. None of the above

As per PD 856 (Sanitation Code of the Phils.), burial grounds for cemeteries, memorial parks, or any place duly authorized by the government for permanent disposal of the dead shall be at least how many meters away from any dwelling unit?…from any source of water supply?                                                                                                                                                                                                                       a. 15, 25       b. 20, 50        c. 30, 50        d. 50, 100

Refers to the occurrence in a community or region of cases of an illness clearly in excess of expectancy.                                                            a. Epidemic       b. Mobidity       c. Pestilence       d. Expectancy

An epidemic causing high mortality.                                                                                                                                                                          a. Epidemic      b. Mobidity      c. Pestilence      d. Expectancy

These two bodies lay down the policy guidelines and take decisions regarding the direction, character and objectives of the local development. They do these in their capacity as elected representatives of the people. In a very real sense, they are the true planner of the city, municipality or province
I. Local Sangunian 
II. non-elective officials of the LGU
III. Local Devt Council 
IV. Heads of the National Agencies operating in the area
V. non-government sectors                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     

a. I, II,III      b. I, II, III, IV, V      c. I, III      d. II, IV V      e. I, III, IV, V
End of ENP Quiz 1
